intro: Pleurophragma integrifolium, commonly known as the smoothleaf pleurophragma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its alternate, smooth-edged leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
